segment.source: Provide deep links from the background app service in Cortana to launch the app to the foreground in a specific state or context.
segment.target: Provide deep links from the background app service in Cortana to launch the app to the foreground in a specific state or context.

segment.source: Deep link from Cortana to a background app
segment.target: Deep link from Cortana to a background app

segment.source: Deep link from Cortana to a background app
segment.target: Deep link from Cortana to a background app

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands
segment.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands

segment.source: Voice Command Definition (VCD) elements and attributes v1.2
segment.target: Voice Command Definition (VCD) elements and attributes v1.2

segment.source: Provide deep links from a background app in Cortana that launch the app to the foreground in a specific state or context.
segment.target: Provide deep links from a background app in Cortana that launch the app to the foreground in a specific state or context.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Both Cortana and the background app service are terminated when the foreground app is launched.
segment.target: Both Cortana and the background app service are terminated when the foreground app is launched.

segment.source: A deep link is displayed by default on the Cortana completion screen as shown here ("Go to AdventureWorks"), but you can display deep links on various other screens.
segment.target: A deep link is displayed by default on the Cortana completion screen as shown here ("Go to AdventureWorks"), but you can display deep links on various other screens.

segment.source: cortana background app completion screen
segment.target: cortana background app completion screen

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: This topic builds on Interact with a background app in Cortana.
segment.target: This topic builds on Interact with a background app in Cortana.

segment.source: We continue using a trip planning and management app named Adventure Works to demonstrate various Cortana features.
segment.target: We continue using a trip planning and management app named Adventure Works to demonstrate various Cortana features.

segment.source: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.
segment.target: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.

segment.source: Create your first app
segment.target: Create your first app

segment.source: Learn about events with Events and routed events overview
segment.target: Learn about events with Events and routed events overview

segment.source: User experience guidelines:
segment.target: User experience guidelines:

segment.source: See Cortana design guidelines for info about how to integrate your app with Cortana and Speech design guidelines for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.
segment.target: See Cortana design guidelines for info about how to integrate your app with Cortana and Speech design guidelines for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.

segment.source: Overview
segment.target: Overview

segment.source: Users can access your app through Cortana by:
segment.target: Users can access your app through Cortana by:

segment.source: Activating it as a foreground app (see Activate a foreground app with voice commands through Cortana).
segment.target: Activating it as a foreground app (see Activate a foreground app with voice commands through Cortana).

segment.source: Exposing specific functionality as a background app service (see Activate a background app with voice commands through Cortana).
segment.target: Exposing specific functionality as a background app service (see Activate a background app with voice commands through Cortana).

segment.source: Deep linking to specific pages, content, and state or context.
segment.target: Deep linking to specific pages, content, and state or context.

segment.source: We discuss deep linking here.
segment.target: We discuss deep linking here.

segment.source: Deep linking is useful when Cortana and your app service act as a gateway to your full-featured app (instead of requiring the user to launch the app through the Start menu), or for providing access to richer detail and functionality within your app that is not possible through Cortana.
segment.target: Deep linking is useful when Cortana and your app service act as a gateway to your full-featured app (instead of requiring the user to launch the app through the Start menu), or for providing access to richer detail and functionality within your app that is not possible through Cortana.

segment.source: Deep linking is another way to increase usability and promote your app.
segment.target: Deep linking is another way to increase usability and promote your app.

segment.source: There are three ways to provide deep links:
segment.target: There are three ways to provide deep links:

segment.source: A "Go to app" link on various Cortana screens.
segment.target: A "Go to app" link on various Cortana screens.

segment.source: A link embedded in a content tile on various Cortana screens.
segment.target: A link embedded in a content tile on various Cortana screens.

segment.source: Programmatically launching the foreground app from the background app service.
segment.target: Programmatically launching the foreground app from the background app service.

segment.source: "Go to app" deep link
segment.target: "Go to app" deep link

segment.source: Cortana displays a "Go to app" deep link below the content card on most screens.
segment.target: Cortana displays a "Go to app" deep link below the content card on most screens.

segment.source: cortana background app completion screen
segment.target: cortana background app completion screen

segment.source: You can provide a launch argument for this link that opens your app in similar context as the app service.
segment.target: You can provide a launch argument for this link that opens your app in similar context as the app service.

segment.source: If you don't provide a launch argument, the app is launched to the main screen.
segment.target: If you don't provide a launch argument, the app is launched to the main screen.

segment.source: In this example from AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs of the AdventureWorks sample, we pass the specified destination () string to the SendCompletionMessageForDestination method, which retrieves all matching trips and provides a deep link to the app.
segment.target: In this example from AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs of the AdventureWorks sample, we pass the specified destination () string to the SendCompletionMessageForDestination method, which retrieves all matching trips and provides a deep link to the app.

segment.source: First, we create a VoiceCommandUserMessage () that is spoken by Cortana and shown on the Cortana canvas.
segment.target: First, we create a VoiceCommandUserMessage () that is spoken by Cortana and shown on the Cortana canvas.

segment.source: A VoiceCommandContentTile list object is then created for displaying the collection of result cards on the canvas.
segment.target: A VoiceCommandContentTile list object is then created for displaying the collection of result cards on the canvas.

segment.source: These two objects are then passed to the CreateResponse method of the VoiceCommandResponse object ().
segment.target: These two objects are then passed to the CreateResponse method of the VoiceCommandResponse object ().

segment.source: We then set the AppLaunchArgument property value of the response object to the value of passsed to this function.
segment.target: We then set the AppLaunchArgument property value of the response object to the value of passsed to this function.

segment.source: When a user taps a content tile on the Cortana canvas, the parameter values are passed to the app through the response object.
segment.target: When a user taps a content tile on the Cortana canvas, the parameter values are passed to the app through the response object.

segment.source: Finally, we call the ReportSuccessAsync method of the VoiceCommandServiceConnection.
segment.target: Finally, we call the ReportSuccessAsync method of the VoiceCommandServiceConnection.

segment.source: Content tile deep link
segment.target: Content tile deep link

segment.source: You can add deep links to content cards on various Cortana screens.
segment.target: You can add deep links to content cards on various Cortana screens.

segment.source: cortana background app hand-off screen
segment.target: cortana background app hand-off screen

segment.source: Like the "Go to app" links, you can provide a launch argument to open your app with similar context as the app service.
segment.target: Like the "Go to app" links, you can provide a launch argument to open your app with similar context as the app service.

segment.source: If you don't provide a launch argument, the content tile does not link to your app.
segment.target: If you don't provide a launch argument, the content tile does not link to your app.

segment.source: In this example from AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs of the AdventureWorks sample, we pass the specified destination to the SendCompletionMessageForDestination method, which retrieves all matching trips and provides content cards with deep links to the app.
segment.target: In this example from AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs of the AdventureWorks sample, we pass the specified destination to the SendCompletionMessageForDestination method, which retrieves all matching trips and provides content cards with deep links to the app.

segment.source: First, we create a VoiceCommandUserMessage () that is spoken by Cortana and shown on the Cortana canvas.
segment.target: First, we create a VoiceCommandUserMessage () that is spoken by Cortana and shown on the Cortana canvas.

segment.source: A VoiceCommandContentTile list object is then created for displaying the collection of result cards on the canvas.
segment.target: A VoiceCommandContentTile list object is then created for displaying the collection of result cards on the canvas.

segment.source: These two objects are then passed to the CreateResponse method of the VoiceCommandResponse object ().
segment.target: These two objects are then passed to the CreateResponse method of the VoiceCommandResponse object ().

segment.source: We then set the AppLaunchArgument property value to the value of the destination in the voice command.
segment.target: We then set the AppLaunchArgument property value to the value of the destination in the voice command.

segment.source: Finally, we call the ReportSuccessAsync method of the VoiceCommandServiceConnection.
segment.target: Finally, we call the ReportSuccessAsync method of the VoiceCommandServiceConnection.

segment.source: Here, we add two content tiles with different AppLaunchArgument parameter values to a VoiceCommandContentTile list used in the ReportSuccessAsync call of the VoiceCommandServiceConnection object.
segment.target: Here, we add two content tiles with different AppLaunchArgument parameter values to a VoiceCommandContentTile list used in the ReportSuccessAsync call of the VoiceCommandServiceConnection object.

segment.source: Programmatic deep link
segment.target: Programmatic deep link

segment.source: You can also programmatically launch your app with a launch argument to open your app with similar context as the app service.
segment.target: You can also programmatically launch your app with a launch argument to open your app with similar context as the app service.

segment.source: If you don't provide a launch argument, the app is launched to the main screen.
segment.target: If you don't provide a launch argument, the app is launched to the main screen.

segment.source: Here, we add an AppLaunchArgument parameter with a value of "Las Vegas" to a VoiceCommandResponse object used in the RequestAppLaunchAsync call of the VoiceCommandServiceConnection object.
segment.target: Here, we add an AppLaunchArgument parameter with a value of "Las Vegas" to a VoiceCommandResponse object used in the RequestAppLaunchAsync call of the VoiceCommandServiceConnection object.

segment.source: App manifest
segment.target: App manifest

segment.source: To enable deep linking to your app, you must declare the extension in the Package.appxmanifest file of your app project.
segment.target: To enable deep linking to your app, you must declare the extension in the Package.appxmanifest file of your app project.

segment.source: Here, we declare the extension for the Adventure Works app.
segment.target: Here, we declare the extension for the Adventure Works app.

segment.source: Protocol contract
segment.target: Protocol contract

segment.source: Your app is launched to the foreground through Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) activation using a Protocol contract.
segment.target: Your app is launched to the foreground through Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) activation using a Protocol contract.

segment.source: Your app must override your app's OnActivated event and check for an ActivationKind of Protocol.
segment.target: Your app must override your app's OnActivated event and check for an ActivationKind of Protocol.

segment.source: For more info, see Handle URI activation.
segment.target: For more info, see Handle URI activation.

segment.source: Here, we decode the URI provided by the ProtocolActivatedEventArgs to access the launch argument.
segment.target: Here, we decode the URI provided by the ProtocolActivatedEventArgs to access the launch argument.

segment.source: For this example, the Uri is set to "windows.personalassistantlaunch:?LaunchContext=Las Vegas".
segment.target: For this example, the Uri is set to "windows.personalassistantlaunch:?LaunchContext=Las Vegas".
